revised_title: Determining the Sun's Parallax Through the Observations of the Internal Contact of Venus
tldr: The author, James Short, describes the observations of the internal contact of Venus with the Sun's limb during a transit, made at various locations in Europe and compared with the same contact observed at the Cape of Good Hope. These observations were used to determine the parallax of the Sun, which is essential for calculating the distance between the Earth and other celestial bodies.
